Directions

Learning objective:
Connect Bernoulli’s equation and continuity to the velocity and volumetric flow rates in a branching pipe network.

How to use the simulation:
Use the sliders to set the inlet gauge pressure and the radii of the left and right outlet pipes. The schematic updates to show the current geometry along with velocity arrows and pressure labels. The values in the panel list the computed velocities and the corresponding volumetric flow rates. All calculations assume steady, incompressible flow with negligible head losses.

Quantitative understanding:
Observe that increasing the inlet pressure raises all velocities, while increasing the outlet radii decreases the inlet velocity needed to satisfy Bernoulli’s relation. Confirm that the inlet volumetric flow rate always equals the sum of the outlet flow rates.
